title: Shirley Ballas hooked up to drip as she falls ill ahead of Strictly weekend
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

We’re already one regular judge down on Strictly Come Dancing, what with Bruno Tonioli skipping this weekend’s show due to US work commitments.

And it looks like Shirley Ballas is at risk of dropping out too.

The 59-year-old has shared pictures of herself hooked up to a drip after falling ill ahead of the fifth week of Strictly.

Shirley was meant to attend the Global Gift Gala, but instead spent her evening hooked up to an intravenous drip in the hopes of perking up by Saturday.

The dancer explained: ‘Good morning everybody, afternoon. I’m just about to have this intravenous drip and this young lady is going to tell you why.’

Shirley seems to be on the mend (Picture: Shirley Ballas/Instagram)

Shirley will hopefully be better by Saturday (Picture: PA)

Katrina from Reviv explained the drip was a ‘recovery infusion that’s great if you’re feeling sick, hungover, jet-lagged or just under the weather. It’s pumped with B12, it has an anti-inflammatory medication, vitamin C, magnesium and all the stuff that’ll make Shirley feel better – especially during this awful weather.’

Shirley added on her Instagram story: ‘Hopefully we’ll be right as rain by Saturday.’

The caption for Shirley’s video and snaps read: ‘@revivuk very happy to receive this drip today to help me get well. Full of all sorts of things vitamin c magnesium b12 and the list goes on. Feeling under the weather today as a result of a tough week.

‘So @revivuk will have me up and running by Saturday @#gratitude #sick #health #feelingbetter.’

The scores were all over the place (Picture: BBC)

Shirley, dressed in a Moschino hoodie, was smiling away as she enjoyed a cup of tea and a recline while having her drip, so we’re not too worried.

It’s been a rather rough week for Ms Ballas, as there has been major backlash to her and the judges’ decisions on Saturday and Sunday night.

The panel – Shirley, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli – were called out for their ‘odd’ scoring on Saturday night, after Mike Bushell was awarded a nine and David James received eights.

Advertisement

After the leaderboard was turned on its head, Viscountess Emma Weymouth and Dev Griffin ended up in the bottom two, and, after the dance-off, the judges chose to send Dev and his partner Dianne Buswell home.

And apparently, Shirley received death threats after the decision, which Dianne has called for a stop too.

A fan of the Aussie dancer tweeted: ‘Please sort your fans out @dbuzz6589& @Joe_Sugg. I get why people are upset & I don’t think it was @dev_101’s time to go. But sending vile abusive tweets & death threats to @ShirleyBallas is totally out of order. Imagine if it was a member of your family on the receiving end.’

Dianne, 30, replied: ‘Guys this is terrible you can not be bullying like this . It’s awful and really upsets me to hear this . It’s simply not ok and should never happen!’

Strictly returns on Saturday night on BBC One.
